school_chapter_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE What if you don't pay?
school_lesson_subtitle1: PLZ_TRANSLATE Read the story to unlock the challenge. Take all the time you need and you can always redo them if you need to.
school_lesson_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why do things cost what they cost?
school_lesson_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Is it cheap or expensive?
school_story_midpoint_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hey! You are already half way through. Nice!
school_story_end1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Good job! Now you can do the challenge to test what you learned. Remember that you can always redo the story if you dont recall everything.
school_story_1_screen_text1: PLZ_TRANSLATE Money is really just pieces of paper. It's us humans who have decided what money should be worth.
school_story_1_screen_text2: PLZ_TRANSLATE Money is what is called a legal tender.
school_story_1_screen_text3: PLZ_TRANSLATE In the past, before there even was money, people exchanged things with each other. It was called barter!
school_story_1_screen_text4: PLZ_TRANSLATE Have you exchanged something with a friend or sibling?
school_story_1_screen_text5: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you happened to be good at baking, but wanted meat as well, you could exchange your bread for meat with a butcher.
school_story_1_screen_text7: PLZ_TRANSLATE But you couldn't exchange one loaf of bread for just anything, some things were worth more.
school_story_1_screen_text8: PLZ_TRANSLATE What do you think is worth the most?
school_story_1_screen_text11: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you wanted to exchange bread for something that was worth more, you would have to agree with the other vendor how many loaves of bread it was worth.
school_story_1_screen_text12: PLZ_TRANSLATE But how would you calculate it?
school_story_1_screen_text13: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, the worth of things is usually determined by how expensive the raw materials or parts of it are.
school_story_1_screen_text14: PLZ_TRANSLATE To bake bread you need flour, yeast, water and maybe some other things.
school_story_1_screen_text15: PLZ_TRANSLATE Those are the raw materials for bread.
school_story_1_screen_text16: PLZ_TRANSLATE Another example is fabric and thread to sew clothes. The raw materials for clothes are more expensive than the raw materials for bread.
school_story_1_screen_text17: PLZ_TRANSLATE But when determining the worth you also have to take into account how hard it is and how long it takes to make.
school_story_1_screen_text18: PLZ_TRANSLATE ...in our example, it takes longer time to sew a pair of pants than baking a loaf of bread.
school_story_1_screen_text19: PLZ_TRANSLATE So if you had bread but wanted to barter for a pair of pants, you would have to exchange a couple of loaves for the other person to be satisfied.
school_story_1_screen_text20: PLZ_TRANSLATE Today, there are also some other things to take into account when you determine or calculate value. But we will talk about that some other time!
school_story_1_screen_text21: PLZ_TRANSLATE These were the basics to what money and value is.
school_story_2_screen_text1: PLZ_TRANSLATE It worked to exchange and barter bread for meat and other goods for a while...
school_story_2_screen_text2: PLZ_TRANSLATE But when people started to travel more, it became a hassle to carry around so much bread.
school_story_2_screen_text3: PLZ_TRANSLATE And some goods like bread or meat go bad and moldy pretty fast.
school_story_2_screen_text4: PLZ_TRANSLATE That's why people started using legal tender instead!
school_story_2_screen_text5: PLZ_TRANSLATE Legal tender is what you give a seller instead of exchanging an item.
school_story_2_screen_text6: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you bought pants for money, you used legal tender!
school_story_2_screen_text7: PLZ_TRANSLATE In the past they used some weird things before money was invented. It could be stones, sea shells or whale teeth for example.
school_story_2_screen_text8: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yeah, you're right, whale teeth sounds a bit grose to keep in your pocket. People were probably relieved when they started making legal tender in silver and gold instead.
school_story_2_screen_text9: PLZ_TRANSLATE Can you guess what that was?
school_story_2_screen_text11: PLZ_TRANSLATE When the first coins where made, they made them out of silver or gold. You decided how much the coins were worth by weighing them.
school_story_2_screen_text12: PLZ_TRANSLATE That's where they saying “Worth its weight in gold“ comes from!
school_story_2_screen_text13: PLZ_TRANSLATE What do you think, doesn't it seem easier to carry a bag of coins than several sacks of bread?
school_story_2_screen_text14: PLZ_TRANSLATE Coins were used for a long time, we still do! But when people started to own a lot of coins, it got heavy!
school_story_2_screen_text15: PLZ_TRANSLATE They were also easy to steal. So banks started storing people's coins in exchange for written receipts.
school_story_2_screen_text16: PLZ_TRANSLATE When you wanted to buy things, you just paid with the receipts. As the receipts became widely used, they decided to make bills. Those are the same bills we use today.
school_story_2_screen_text17: PLZ_TRANSLATE It might sound a bit funny, but like I said before, it's us people that have decided how much coins and bills should be worth.
school_story_2_screen_text18: PLZ_TRANSLATE That's why we can pay with bills even though they are really just pieces of paper, which are cheap to make.
school_story_2_screen_text19: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, so, the bills we use to pay for expensive things...
school_story_2_screen_text20: PLZ_TRANSLATE ...are made of the same thing as toilet paper!
school_story_3_screen_text1: PLZ_TRANSLATE Today it's unusal to pay with coins and bills. But when your parents were your age, they couldn´t pay with their phones! They had to pay with cash.
school_story_3_screen_text2: PLZ_TRANSLATE That's how it was. There were even more coins than today!
school_story_3_screen_text3: PLZ_TRANSLATE Have you payed with coins or bills in the store?
school_story_3_screen_text4: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, today most money is digital. They exist as digits in the bank, you could say. But it's still legal tender.
school_story_3_screen_text5: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's pretend you have a 50 piggybucks bill
school_story_3_screen_text6: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you deposit it in the bank, they will take your bill. But you will still have 50 piggybucks, just in a digital form.
school_story_3_screen_text7: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you want to use your digital money to buy something, you use a bank card, like the Gimi card!
school_story_3_screen_text8: PLZ_TRANSLATE You get the card from Gimi or a bank for example.
school_story_3_screen_text9: PLZ_TRANSLATE Money just doesn't show up in the bank or your account, someone has to deposit them there first.
school_story_3_screen_text10: PLZ_TRANSLATE When the money is in the account you can't hold them, but it's really the same thing anyway.
school_story_3_screen_text11: PLZ_TRANSLATE The amount of money you have in your account is called balance.
school_story_3_screen_text12: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's a little tricky to keep track of your money when you can't hold them in your hand or keep them in a wallet.
school_story_3_screen_text13: PLZ_TRANSLATE But you can learn how! One way to do so is to make a budget.
school_story_3_screen_text14: PLZ_TRANSLATE A budget as you might already know is a structure and plan for how much money you have and how much you spend.
school_story_3_screen_text15: PLZ_TRANSLATE Expenses are what you pay for or buy. Income is the money that you get or earn.
school_story_3_screen_text16: PLZ_TRANSLATE We will talk more about what a budget is and how to make one in another chapter.
school_story_3_screen_text17: PLZ_TRANSLATE The most important part is to remember how much you spend...
school_story_3_screen_text18: PLZ_TRANSLATE ...and calculate how much you have left. Then you can keep track of your money even if it's digital.
school_story_4_screen_text1: PLZ_TRANSLATE Like I said in the previous chapter, the price depends on how expensive raw materials are and how long it takes to make
school_story_4_screen_text2: PLZ_TRANSLATE But it is only part of the truth.
school_story_4_screen_text3: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because the price of a product also depends on other things.
school_story_4_screen_text4: PLZ_TRANSLATE Products, as you may know, is the word for things that you can buy.
school_story_4_screen_text8: PLZ_TRANSLATE A thing you can buy!
school_story_4_screen_text9: PLZ_TRANSLATE Except the raw materials and time it takes to make, it is also something called supply and demand that can affect the price.
school_story_4_screen_text10: PLZ_TRANSLATE How much there is of something or how easy it is to get is called:
school_story_4_screen_text12: PLZ_TRANSLATE How many that want the product or how much people want it is called:
school_story_4_screen_text14: PLZ_TRANSLATE You will learn more about supply and demand in the next story but I want to talk more about price and value right now.
school_story_4_screen_text15: PLZ_TRANSLATE Cost and value are a bit different.
school_story_4_screen_text16: PLZ_TRANSLATE The cost is what you pay for the product. The price of it.
school_story_4_screen_text17: PLZ_TRANSLATE The price is often calculated by adding the cost for raw materials and time it takes to make, and then that is affected by the supply and demand that I talked about.
school_story_4_screen_text18: PLZ_TRANSLATE But value and worth is a little more complicated.
school_story_4_screen_text19: PLZ_TRANSLATE Maybe you have heard people say that something was 'worth the cost' or 'worth paying for.'
school_story_4_screen_text20: PLZ_TRANSLATE But what do they actually mean when they say that?
school_story_4_screen_text21: PLZ_TRANSLATE To understnad value better you have to start by learning that there are two kinds of value; subjective value and objective value.
school_story_4_screen_text22: PLZ_TRANSLATE Wow, those were also difficult words!
school_story_4_screen_text23: PLZ_TRANSLATE I will explain these words and then you will get to practice in the challenge before I teach you more.
school_story_4_screen_text24: PLZ_TRANSLATE Something is subjective when you see it from your own point of view. When you have an opinion about it.
school_story_4_screen_text25: PLZ_TRANSLATE So subjective value is if you think an icecream is worth 30pb for example.  You might think that a varm summer day, but not in the middle of winter.
school_story_4_screen_text26: PLZ_TRANSLATE Something is objective when you see it from a point of view that is not personal. So it usually is about facts and not about peoples opinion and what people think.
school_story_4_screen_text27: PLZ_TRANSLATE The objective value is often pretty close to the price of a product, otherwise it can be hard get people to buy it.
school_story_4_screen_text28: PLZ_TRANSLATE On this planet we will talk about objective value, as it is the one that is important when speaking of cost and pricing.
school_story_4_screen_text29: PLZ_TRANSLATE Subjective value we will save for later, when we speak about spending and your personal economy.
school_story_5_screen_text7: PLZ_TRANSLATE When it is apple season and they are easy to get, the apples are cheaper.
school_story_5_screen_text8: PLZ_TRANSLATE But in the spring apples are not in season. Then maybe they have to be imported from other countries.
school_story_5_screen_text9: PLZ_TRANSLATE Then the sellers can make the price higher because people will buy them anyway, and can’t pick them at home.
school_story_5_screen_text10: PLZ_TRANSLATE With demand it’s the opposite. If many people want something…
school_story_5_screen_text11: PLZ_TRANSLATE …the sellers can make the price higher.
school_story_5_screen_text12: PLZ_TRANSLATE But if the demand is low and not that many want to buy the product…
school_story_5_screen_text13: PLZ_TRANSLATE …they have to lower the price to try and make people buy it.
school_story_5_screen_text14: PLZ_TRANSLATE An example for demand is when a gaming company is selling a new console. When they release a new one they can set a high price because many want it.
school_story_5_screen_text15: PLZ_TRANSLATE But then they also have to lower the price of the old ones because less people want to buy the old models when there is a new one.
school_story_5_screen_text16: PLZ_TRANSLATE The summary you should remember is:
school_story_5_screen_text17:
PLZ_TRANSLATE If the supply is high the price is low. 
If the demand is high the price is high.
school_story_5_screen_text18: PLZ_TRANSLATE Even easier to remember it this way:
school_story_5_screen_text19:
PLZ_TRANSLATE If there is a lot and enough for everyone it is cheaper. 
If there is less of something than people that want it, its more expensive.
school_story_6_screen_text2: PLZ_TRANSLATE That's why we have talked about value and price before in this chapter. And supply and demand!
school_story_6_screen_text3: PLZ_TRANSLATE You probably now understnand more about WHY things have different prices and that it depends on a lot of things. But now I will try to teach you HOW MUCH things cost.
school_story_6_screen_text4: PLZ_TRANSLATE I will start by asking you: Do you think it is good to buy something expensive?
school_story_6_screen_text5: PLZ_TRANSLATE Difficult question! Because something can be expensive because it costs a lot of money, or just more expensive than it usually is.
school_story_6_screen_text6: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you can afford something that costs a lot, but it is more expensive than it usually is, its better to wait for a better price.
school_story_6_screen_text7: PLZ_TRANSLATE How do you really know if something is cheap or expensive?
school_story_6_screen_text8: PLZ_TRANSLATE The easiest answer is that you do it through knowing the price the things you buy often. Then you know what they usually cost and can compare.
school_story_6_screen_text9: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you are buying something you don't know the price of, you can go to different stores and check it.
school_story_6_screen_text10: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now a days, with internet it's fast!
school_story_6_screen_text11: PLZ_TRANSLATE When you try to decide if something is cheap or expensive, it's almost always about comparing prices and products.
school_story_6_screen_text12:
PLZ_TRANSLATE You can compare between products that are tsimilar in some way. 
And you can compare prices of the same product in different stores.
school_story_6_screen_text13: PLZ_TRANSLATE To find out if you think a price of a product is okey you can compare it to other products as well.
school_story_6_screen_text14: PLZ_TRANSLATE We will do an example to explain it the best!
school_story_6_screen_text15: PLZ_TRANSLATE Pretend that you want to buy french fries at a food stand, but want to compare if they want a fair price for them.
school_story_6_screen_text16: PLZ_TRANSLATE They also sell pizza and ice cream at the food stand.
school_story_6_screen_text17: PLZ_TRANSLATE They sell the french fries for 50pb. To compare you then look at the price for pizza and ice cream as well.
school_story_6_screen_text18: PLZ_TRANSLATE A pizza should be more expensive than french fries. The ice cream should be cheaper. Do you know why?
school_story_6_screen_text19: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, well, the pizza is worth more, because the raw materials are more expensive and it takes more time and effort to make it.
school_story_6_screen_text20: PLZ_TRANSLATE And the ice cream should be cheaper for the same reason, and the ice cream is also a smaller portion of food than the ice cream or pizza.
school_story_6_screen_text21:
PLZ_TRANSLATE In this food stand they want 85pb for a pizza. 
The ice cream is 26pb.
school_story_6_screen_text22: PLZ_TRANSLATE Are the prices fair when you compare the products?
school_story_6_screen_text23: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes they are! The ice cream is the cheapest, the pizza is the most expensive and the french fries are between them in price.
school_story_6_screen_text24: PLZ_TRANSLATE But then you still don't know so much about if it is cheap or expensive...
school_story_6_screen_text25: PLZ_TRANSLATE Then, you can also compare prices of the same product in different stores. So you could check in the food stands close what a portion of french fries costs.
school_story_6_screen_text26: PLZ_TRANSLATE The food stand where you were first, wanted 50pb. In the food stand next to it they want 67pb for french fries.
school_story_6_screen_text27:
PLZ_TRANSLATE The food stand closest was the cheapest! 
 But, as you know, sometimes you choose between price and value.
school_story_6_screen_text28: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because if you know that the more expensive food stand have tastier french fries and larger portions, you might buy the more expensive ones, because then it's worth it!
school_story_6_screen_text29: PLZ_TRANSLATE I myself also think it's a bit confusing and messy sometimes, but if you practice in different situations you learn!
school_story_7_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I wondered for a long time what currencies really are..
school_story_7_screen_1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The easiest answer I learned is that it is money!
school_story_7_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You already learned how and why people started using money and some history of money.
school_story_7_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE When people used coins of gold and silver, you could use them all over the world. As the weight of them decided their worth.
school_story_7_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But when the exchange of coins for bills was more and more common, money started to look different in different countries.
school_story_7_screen_4_title:
PLZ_TRANSLATE So to answer our question again  from the beginning what currency is; 
currency is another word for money.
school_story_7_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE When talking about different types of money you use the word “currency.“
school_story_7_screen_5_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Most countries have their own currency.
school_story_7_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But there are also larger currencies that are used by more than one country.
school_story_7_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Dollars and Euros are examples of currencies used by more countries.
school_story_7_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's go back to the times when bills were still new.
school_story_7_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE To control money and to make sure it could not be faked or forged, the countries started central banks. And they centralized the currency.
school_story_7_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE This means that some agency in the country, usually the state, took over the control of making the money. So regular banks could not decide that anymore.
school_story_7_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The state decided how much the different bills and coins would be worth and how the money would look. Also how much money to print.
school_story_7_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE They then started places called a mint. The mint was, and still is, the place where the government makes the money.
school_story_7_screen_11_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Through the years they have come up with ways of making the bills in a way so it is very hard to forge or fake money.
school_story_7_screen_11_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So not like toilet paper anymore
school_story_7_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Quite a difference between the bills we have today and hand written receipts right?
school_story_7_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Sorry didn't see what you answered got distracted by my cat Fido...
school_story_7_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But the correct answer is: Money!
school_story_7_screen_14_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Isn't Fido a dog's name?
school_story_7_screen_14_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have a pet too!
school_story_7_screen_14_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't have a pet
school_story_7_screen_14_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have ants in my pants
school_story_7_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So with all this, it again became a bit harder to trade and buy things between countries.
school_story_7_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE A merchant in Germany for example, could not know if a piece of paper from Sweden was worth anything.
school_story_7_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Or if it was just paper.
school_story_7_screen_16_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Right, the paper problem again
school_story_7_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So when the countries started to have the centralized currency (controlled by the state)
school_story_7_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE They also had to make a system so that people could know what relationship the different currencies had to each other.
school_story_7_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you go to Spain and have 10pb, how much is that in their country? In their currency?
school_story_7_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE To know this you look at the exchange rates of currency.
school_story_7_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't know about you but this is enough info for me for now.
school_story_7_screen_19_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's do the next story about exchange rates. See you there!
school_story_8_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Oh, hi! Back to learn I see!
school_story_8_screen_1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE I was just unpacking my bag from travelling.
school_story_8_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I went to Europe, and travelled around there. I've always liked to travel.
school_story_8_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now I have a bunch of different currencies from different countries to unpack... I collect them!
school_story_8_screen_2_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You taught me what currecy is!
school_story_8_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I did! Remember I told you that most countries have their own currencies?
school_story_8_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Like in the country where you live, you have a currency. What currency do you have?
school_story_8_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, whatever currency you have, if you travel to a country where they use a different one you have to exchange money to their currency.
school_story_8_screen_4_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I know, I have travelled a lot
school_story_8_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE That's how it is, because they use their own money and to be able to buy anything you need to have the same currency.
school_story_8_screen_5_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Like I mentioned before, that is called exchanging money. Or more formally; currency exchange.
school_story_8_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is a bit different in different countries. Some countries have a lot of digital money and some use a lot of cash.
school_story_8_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So it depends on how it is in the country you travel to.
school_story_8_screen_6_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE We pay mostly with cash
school_story_8_screen_6_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Here we mostly use cards
school_story_8_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you are in a country where they don't use cards that much, you bring your own currency with you there to exchange.
school_story_8_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There are usually special currency exchange shops in those countries.
school_story_8_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can also exchange the money at home before you go. All countries have places to exchange money. Even yours!
school_story_8_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Not that long ago this what you had to do when you travelled. Cash was king!
school_story_8_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I like using other currency
school_story_8_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's easier in countries where you pay a lot with your bank or credit card, and cash is not needed as much.
school_story_8_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Then you don't have to go to a special place to exchange the money.
school_story_8_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can use most bank cards all over the world.
school_story_8_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So you pay directly with your card and your bank makes the currency exchange digitally.
school_story_8_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Sometimes you still need cash! Then you can take out money from an ATM there as well.
school_story_8_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Same thing if you do it this way. Then the bank makes the exchange digitally.
school_story_8_screen_12_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Why are you repeating that?
school_story_8_screen_12_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Is that important to know?
school_story_8_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is important to understand.
school_story_8_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Understand what, you probably wonder?
school_story_8_screen_13_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Not really, but tell me
school_story_8_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE That it is an exchange, however you do it; digitally or manually.
school_story_8_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You exchange one currency for another. And that's true also when you shop abroad in the store with a card.
school_story_8_screen_14_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I still need more info
school_story_8_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Different currencies are not worth the same.
school_story_8_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Do you remember how it worked in barter if you had bread, but wanted to exchange it for pants?
school_story_8_screen_16_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Pants were worth more than bread?
school_story_8_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You would give away several loaves of bread because a pair of pants are worth more than a loaf of bread.
school_story_8_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE With currency it works the same way really.
school_story_8_screen_17_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I think I get it
school_story_8_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If one currency is worth more than the other, you give more of it than you get back in the exchange.
school_story_8_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's pretend that you want to exchange 1 euro for 1 piggybuck. piggybucks are worth 2 euros.
school_story_8_screen_19_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE This is the currency rate. And you would have to give me 2 euros to get 1 piggybuck.
school_story_8_screen_20_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It might seem unfair. But the currency rates are all a bit different and they are decided globally. So all countries agree to them.
school_story_8_screen_20_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can see the currency rate as that currency's price.
school_story_8_screen_20_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE How do you know the currency rate?
school_story_8_screen_21_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can check the currency rate for any currency in the world easily online. But make sure you use the right source!
school_story_8_screen_21_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Banks are a good source to find out the correct exchange rates.
school_story_8_screen_21_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I will check it out!
school_story_8_screen_22_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, I better go back to unpacking my currencies for my collection!
school_story_9_screen_1_title:
PLZ_TRANSLATE Ready to dive a little deeper into currency and specifically crypto currency?
Crypto currencies haven't existed very long.
school_story_9_screen_1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE About 20 years ago the first ever crypto currency came; BitCoin.
school_story_9_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now there are more of them, like Litecoin or Ethereum. Crypto currencies only exist online on screen, in a digital form.
school_story_9_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But there are also other important differences between these and regular ones.
school_story_9_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The most important difference, is that they are decentralized.
school_story_9_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's do a recap of what we know about the regular or classical currencies.
school_story_9_screen_3_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Please do, I don't remember
school_story_9_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, remember I told you about how the governments took control over the money?
school_story_9_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It didn't happen everywhere at the same time, but all regular currencies became centralized. Usually by the state.
school_story_9_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Every centralized currency has a central bank controlling it. For example the american dollar in USA has the Federal Reserve.
school_story_9_screen_5_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The first central bank in the world was and still is in Sweden. It's called Riksbanken and was founded in 1668.
school_story_9_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE When they took control over it, deciding the value of the money, they centralized the currency.
school_story_9_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Meaning that the state now was responsible for the value, but also to print the money and decide how much to make.
school_story_9_screen_6_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hey, why don't they just make a lot?
school_story_9_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Unfortunately its not that easy. Supply and demand also applies here actually.
school_story_9_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If a country just starts to print a lot of money, that will start a process where it will lose it's value.
school_story_9_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I know, economical systems are quite complicated, but it's good if we understand the basics. Let's do a simple example.
school_story_9_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Remember the example of supply and demand and the price of apples?
school_story_9_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, but remind me of the details
school_story_9_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Right, so we were talking about supply, and I told you that when it is apple season, stores can't have high prices on apples
school_story_9_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because it is so easy for the buyer to get them everywhere, apples loose value.
school_story_9_screen_11_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now you have part of the picture, and we'll add demand. Remember? Demand is how many that want a product.
school_story_9_screen_11_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And when demand is high price goes up. Now imagine you have a store selling shoes.
school_story_9_screen_11_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I will sell blue shoes
school_story_9_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE One day you realize that more and more people have bought shoes lately.
school_story_9_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Also, they buy three pairs at a time! Wouldn't you increase the prices?
school_story_9_screen_12_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Absolutely! I would make more money!
school_story_9_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, any good buissness man or woman would!
school_story_9_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's put the pieces together now to understand why it's not good to flood the country with money.
school_story_9_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So, the state prints a lot of extra money, it is more available and people have more. They start buying more and spending more.
school_story_9_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Like you in your shoe shop, all vendors and stores raise their prices. Everything gets more expensive. And the money loses value.
school_story_9_screen_14_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, that doesn't sound good
school_story_9_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, its not. And it becomes a bad cycle that the whole country suffers from and it is not an easy situation to fix.
school_story_9_screen_15_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have heard that before
school_story_9_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now that you know more about centralized currency and what that means, we can go back to the other type of currency: crypto currency.
school_story_9_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Crypto currency is NOT centralized. No state or central bank controls it. And as it only exists digitally no one prints it.
school_story_9_screen_16_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE How does it work then?
school_story_9_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Good question! Actually, it is more alike the barter system, because it is not backed up with the assurance of value by a central bank.
school_story_9_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE No one guarantees the value of the BitCoin for example, it is completely based on trust between users.
school_story_9_screen_17_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Any money is fine for me!
school_story_9_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The last big difference is that the money transfers go directly between users.
school_story_9_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So it is a so called peer-to-peer system, with no bank or others being involved.
school_story_9_screen_19_title:
PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's sum it up.
There are three major differences between crypto currency and regular currency:
school_story_9_screen_19_subtitle:
PLZ_TRANSLATE 1.Crypto currency only exists digitally.
2.Regular currency is centralized, crypto currency is not.
3.Crypto currency peer to peer and based on trust.

school_story_12_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Will they pick it up? Or will you send it? You have to have a plan for it before you start.

school_story_12_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't want to nag, but when selling things (or earning, spending or saving) It's important to check with your parents.
school_story_12_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Before you really have financial superskills and a bit older, it's good to ask permission and advice from them, because they are still the ones responsible.
school_story_12_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE My last tip for now, tip nr.4, is one of those ‘earning by spending’ tips I talked about.
school_story_12_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And maybe it's really a savings tip really, but as you put in effort it could be earning as well!
school_story_12_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So i'ts about thinking really hard, planning and comparing prices before you buy something. And maybe even waiting for a sale.
school_story_12_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's say that you have a savings goal you set up. You are saving to buy a...
school_story_12_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Haha, let's say you save for something simpler, like wireless headphones. While you are waiting to have enough money and saving,
school_story_12_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE you can start comparing prices in different stores. When you know what pair of headphones you want, you can check what store that has the best price.
school_story_12_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is very smart, sometimes that could save you a couple of hundreds! And if you are patient and extra nifty, you will plan for a sale...
school_story_12_screen_19_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Either plan to buy them during big sales, like black friday in november, or the christmas sales. Or you can wait when you have saved up until a sale shows up.

school_story_13_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Congratulations on reaching this planet... Because this is a very important planet! Remember, the three staples of private finances are:
school_story_13_screen_1_subtitle:
PLZ_TRANSLATE  Earning, saving and spending.
You already learned a bit about earning on planet 4, here we will talk about saving.
school_story_13_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Before we go on about saving, I wanted to explain another word to you! You know what a product is, it's a thing you can buy. But what about something you buy that is not a thing?
school_story_13_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE That is called a service. Like Netflix, which is a streaming service. Or if you go to a store and pay them to fix your broken screen on the phone, then you buy a service. So you can buy a product, or a service!
school_story_13_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You probably already know what saving means, but I thought I would explain it a bit deeper.
school_story_13_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Do you save any money?
school_story_13_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you do it's great. If you don't, you should really start doing that! Saving is in it's most basic form very simple. It just means that you keep more than you spend.
school_story_13_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Remember in the beginning, when people used coins? The people that had trouble carrying all their coins, they had so much because they had earned and saved a lot.
school_story_13_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can see it clearly when you save coins and bills in a piggy bank in your house, but also if you save in the piggy bank in the Gimi app. The stash grows everytime you save instead of spending!
school_story_13_screen_5_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is very simple math, that you probably already did in the first grades in school. Simple addition and subtraction.
school_story_13_screen_5_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, I learned that already!
school_story_13_screen_5_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE No, haven't been to school yet
school_story_13_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So you probably know also, that everything can be added and subtracted in the same way. Doesn't matter if it is apples, Robux or money.
school_story_13_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's see if you remember what the words I'm using mean... What is addition?
school_story_13_screen_6_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you add things
school_story_13_screen_6_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you take away things
school_story_13_screen_6_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you eat the apples
school_story_13_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you add things! If you have 5 apples, you add 2 and get 7, that's called addition in math.
school_story_13_screen_7_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you add things
school_story_13_screen_7_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you take away things
school_story_13_screen_7_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you eat the apples
school_story_13_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's when you take away, or subtract things! If you have 5 apples and take away 2 and have 3 left, that's called subtraction in math.
school_story_13_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, yes. I know all this!
school_story_13_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I know that this might be very simple for you but I wanted to explain this, just in case.
school_story_13_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Also to make you understand that when dealing with money and finances you use math to count everything, and to understand how things are connected. Often very simple math.
school_story_13_screen_9_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You said saving is important?
school_story_13_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, let's go back to that. I explained the math words, because you can explain it well with math.
school_story_13_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You should never spend more than you have, right?
school_story_13_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Answering why you should not spend more than you have is where addition and subtraction comes in.
school_story_13_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you have those 5 apples, you only have 5 apples. You can't eat more than 5 apples because you don't have anymore.
school_story_13_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But if you deal with money, in bank accounts you can sometimes spend more than you have, and get a negative balance in your account.
school_story_13_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is bad because when you spend more than you have you actually loan money from the bank. Or somebody else. And loans cost money, like you would buy a product or service.
school_story_13_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Also, that means you would have less than you started out with, and would have to pay that back, and also earn more to have some money again.
school_story_13_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay! So, you have 5pb. If you spend 7pb on candy bar, that means you had to borrow or lend 2 pb from the bank.
school_story_13_screen_15_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE This is such easy math!
school_story_13_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Next week maybe you want to buy something else for 3pb. But you don't have any money, and you owe the bank 2pb. Also, if you borrowed from the bank, that loan costs money also.
school_story_13_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Loans from banks and other providers are also a service you have to pay for. So now you owe the bank the 2pb you borrowed, AND the cost of the loan, 0,5pb. If you keep subtracting money and spend, then you will eventually be in debt.
school_story_13_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is bad. I will explain when you get to another planet, about what happens when you overspend, and end up in debt as it is called. You need to know!
school_story_13_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But by saving, you can make sure you have money when you want to spend it, and make sure that you are never have a negative balance!
school_story_13_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because by saving, you add instead of subtracting.
school_story_13_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Of course spending is necessary, and something you should do sometimes. But you should spend in a smart way. And one way of doing that is to save up for things beforehand.
school_story_13_screen_18_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I want to know more!
school_story_13_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let me show you with math again. Let's say you have the same 5pb. You save 3pb every week for three weeks.
school_story_13_screen_20_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now you have 14pb. If you want to buy that candy bar for 7pb, you have 7pb left after the purchase.
school_story_13_screen_20_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You still have money left and don't have to borrow or pay any fees for loans!
school_story_13_screen_20_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But I don't like saving
school_story_13_screen_21_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE That is why saving is important. Spending more than you have is more expensive, and can cause a lot of trouble.
school_story_13_screen_21_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Always making sure to have some money saved up and to have a buffer is very smart money practice and a real financial superskill!
school_story_13_screen_22_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yup, so to summarize this destination's take-away message:
school_story_13_screen_22_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Basic, simple saving is putting away money, letting the sum you have grow over time and earning more than you spend.
school_story_14_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hey, good work in the challenge! I was actually just sitting and sorting my coins in my savings.
school_story_14_screen_1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have done some recycling and helping out around my neighborhood, so I earned some money!
school_story_14_screen_1_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I do that sometimes too
school_story_14_screen_1_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I haven't earned money yet...
school_story_14_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okey, well as you learned on the planet about earning, it's great!
school_story_14_screen_2_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE I love saving money that I earn, then I can see it grow, almost like a plant!
school_story_14_screen_2_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's good when money grows!
school_story_14_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE And when I have a savings goal and can see how I get closer to reaching it, it feels great.
school_story_14_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Now I just have to decide how to save this money I earned. I earned 200pb!
school_story_14_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have had my eye on a space scooter for a while now.. I'ts like a regular scooter but with its own atmosphere.
school_story_14_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Then you don't have to wear a space suit while riding it! And it makes the coolest bluph bluph sound...
school_story_14_screen_4_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Sounds cool, but how about the saving?
school_story_14_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Right! Sorry! So I will come back to the space scooter, but first I will try to tell you more about why saving is important.
school_story_14_screen_5_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I want a space scooter too!
school_story_14_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I did explain previously that saving is very important so that you don't over-spend.
school_story_14_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Because that makes the things you buy more expensive, and it is very hard to catch up once you go that way.
school_story_14_screen_6_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, because loaning costs money
school_story_14_screen_6_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I remember, I will save instead
school_story_14_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE That is really the most important thing about saving. But it is also true that saving is good because you can get more money by saving!
school_story_14_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, when you save your money in a bank, in what is called a savings account, you earn interest.
school_story_14_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Interest is a percentage of money the bank gives you for keeping your money there.
school_story_14_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Wait, the bank gives me money?
school_story_14_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can say that. What happens is that by keeping your money in the bank, you actually loan your money to them.
school_story_14_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And the bank pays you for that loan with an interest on your money. So the longer you keep them there and the more you save, the more you earn!
school_story_14_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The banks guarantee that you will get your money back in the regular saving accounts. But you usually lock them for a time, but after you get them all back, + interest!
school_story_14_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There are other ways to save where there also is a risk of loosing some, but that give even more interest.
school_story_14_screen_10_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I want to earn more, tell me how!
school_story_14_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's wait a bit with those, because it's a bit more you need to know before.
school_story_14_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE There are many different ways to save, but generally they can be divided into long term saving and short term saving.
school_story_14_screen_12_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, long term and short term
school_story_14_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let's start with short term saving.
school_story_14_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The simplest way of short term saving is to put away your money, and try not to spend them.
school_story_14_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It can be pretty hard! But in that way you make sure that you have money for the things you really need or want.
school_story_14_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE The money disappears quickly when you buy a soda here and an ice cream there...
school_story_14_screen_14_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I know, that's why I save!
school_story_14_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Another way of short term saving, is when you save up for something that may not be that expensive.
school_story_14_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So you save your money, but maybe not in a savings account, because you don't want to lock them.
school_story_14_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Long term saving as you might suspect, is when you save for a long time.
school_story_14_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Long term savings can also be for different lengths of time. For example saving for something very expensive like a new smartphone.
school_story_14_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE That would take some time to save up to, maybe even a couple of years if you don't earn extra money. But there are long term savings that last almost your entire life!
school_story_14_screen_17_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I have saved for years already!
school_story_14_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes saving really shouldn't end. The best way is to have a balance between long term and short term savings.
school_story_14_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And you don't have to think about the really long term savings yet, but when you become an adult you should start as soon as possible.
school_story_14_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, I decided. I will divide the money I earned into both long term and short term saving!
school_story_14_screen_19_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE I earned 200pb right? I will put away 150pb, long term for the space scooter.
school_story_14_screen_19_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But then you have 50pb left
school_story_14_screen_20_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, well, I want to save the remaining 50pb in short term savings. So that I have some left to spend.
school_story_14_screen_20_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But only when I need to. I would love some chocolate right now, but I'll skip it. I'll save.
school_story_14_screen_21_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I'll go do that right now. Go practice in the challenge and I'll teach you smart ways to save in the next story!
school_story_15_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If I remember correctly, I promised to teach you even more about saving, specifically smart and nifty ways of doing it?
school_story_15_screen_1_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't remember, the challenge killed it
school_story_15_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE We went through long- and short term savings, but I think I mentioned something about a savings buffer..?
school_story_15_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Haha sorry, I might be a bit tired, I counted my money collections until late last night...
school_story_15_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay. Nevermind. Savings buffer is the topic. A buffer is store of something. In finance, it means that you save up a store, or buffer, of money.
school_story_15_screen_3_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Is my piggybank a buffer?
school_story_15_screen_3_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Hmm... I need to know more
school_story_15_screen_3_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I think I have a savings account
school_story_15_screen_3_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Don't have one I spent it
school_story_15_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Your piggybank could be a savings buffer. It depends on if you have some money saved up. More than you spend.
school_story_15_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE A savings buffer is often what the short time saving that you learned about in the previous story is called.
school_story_15_screen_4_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But what is it for again?
school_story_15_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Well, like I said it is when you save more than you spend, but you save it ‘for a rainy day’
school_story_15_screen_5_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE What's the difference from short term saving?
school_story_15_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE The difference is, that you are not saving up for something special, you are just saving in case something comes up.
school_story_15_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's very important as an adult, as things that are important and expensive can break. Like the car or the heat if you live in a house.
school_story_15_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If the car breaks and it is an expensive repair, maybe you can't afford it after you have payed your bills.
school_story_15_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE But you have to repair it, because you might not get to work otherwise! If you have a savings buffer you have the extra money to pay, without ruining your budget.
school_story_15_screen_7_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But I am not an adult...
school_story_15_screen_7_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't think I need a buffer?
school_story_15_screen_7_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I will start when I grow up
school_story_15_screen_7_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE So I can spend now?
school_story_15_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE But it is important for everyone! Even children.. also cool kids like you. Firstly, like with all finance and money matters it's very important to practice early.
school_story_15_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE These money matters are hard for adults too, and the earlier you start the good habits and practice, the better you will get! That goes for all financial superskills!
school_story_15_screen_8_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, I get it, and more?
school_story_15_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE And second, you also can have things happening that you have to pay for, that you didn't expect. Let's say you just got a new smartphone.
school_story_15_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You drop it, and the screen breaks. Your parents tell you that you should have taken care of it better, and that you have to pay for it yourself.
school_story_15_screen_10_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you Don't have a savings buffer, you would have to save for a long time to get the screen fixed. It's quite expensive!
school_story_15_screen_10_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE And... hmmm, hint, hint. Maybe you then would also buy a screen protector.
school_story_15_screen_10_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I would have to save for months!
school_story_15_screen_12_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes, well think instead that you had a savings buffer. Depending on the size of your buffer it could shorten the time before you can afford to fix the screen...
school_story_15_screen_12_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Or if it is large enough, maybe you can afford it immediately! Not go around for a long time with a broken screen...
school_story_15_screen_12_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I think I will have to start building one
school_story_15_screen_13_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Let me tell you about some smart ways and hacks that can help you save more!
school_story_15_screen_13_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE My first tip is about bonus! As a kid it might be hard to get accounts and interest from banks. But in the Gimi app you can get bonus!
school_story_15_screen_14_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Bonus works like interest. But your parents pay it for the money you save in your Gimi piggybank!
school_story_15_screen_14_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE You can agree and discuss with your parents what the rate should be, and then when you have payday you will get extra money!
school_story_15_screen_15_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Interest rate if you remember, is a percentage from the banks in savings accounts, and bonus works the same way. Let's say you have 100pb in your piggybank.
school_story_15_screen_15_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you have a bonus rate of 0,05%, after payday you will have 5pb extra, just from bonus!
school_story_15_screen_15_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Saving money really pays off!
school_story_15_screen_16_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yup! My second tip is something called ‘matched saving’. It's really simple, it's saving some yourself and getting the same amount for it.
school_story_15_screen_16_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE If you ask your parents, or another family member and see if they would like to negotiate a deal to encourage you and help you to save. Maybe if you save up 100, they will give you 100?
school_story_15_screen_16_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Nah, seems like a lot of work
school_story_15_screen_17_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I don't know, it depends on your family, remember to ask and negotiate in a nice professional manner, don't demand! They don't owe you or have to agree.
school_story_15_screen_17_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, so another hack is to set saving goals. Actually, I have seen that kids that use the goal map in the app and set savings goals are generally better at saving!
school_story_15_screen_17_button_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I use it, am I better at saving?
school_story_15_screen_18_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It is true! So the researchers can't say for sure why, but they can make educated guesses and they think, it's because it is motivating to see your progress!
school_story_15_screen_18_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So if you're not using it and want to get better at saving, use the goal map! Or make your own! The important part is to set a savings goal and check out how it's going along the way.
school_story_15_screen_18_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, cool. Anymore tips or hacks?
school_story_15_screen_19_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yup, I have one last one, and this one you can do all by yourself! It's called the ‘the round-up method.’
school_story_15_screen_19_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's a hack, where you always put away or save some money when you buy things.
school_story_15_screen_20_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE It's also simple, and a way to trick yourself to save often but just a little. But you know what they say: ‘from acorns grow oak trees,’ every little helps!
school_story_15_screen_20_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE So every time you buy something, you round up to the closest 10, or whatever you decide, and you put away the difference in savings.
school_story_15_screen_20_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Can you please give an example?
school_story_15_screen_21_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, an example is that you buy a pizza. The pizza costs 85pb. If you round up to the nearest 10, that is 90pb. The difference between 85 and 90 is 5. You then take 5pb and put in savings.
school_story_15_screen_21_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Or you buy a hat, you pay 349pb, you round up to 350, the difference is 1pb, so you put that in savings.
school_story_15_screen_21_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Sounds like I would save very little?
school_story_15_screen_22_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Yes it's a little every time, but that makes it easy and you don't notice it much. And you do it many times! So it collects! It becomes a way to trick yourself to save! And everything you save is great!
school_story_15_screen_22_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Okay, I think you are ready for the challenge! And try one of the tips!
school_story_16_screen_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Nu du! Nu ska vi ut och shoppa järnet! Nä förlåt. Jag måste ju stanna här med katten Fido. Hon hatar folksamlingar...
school_story_16_screen_1_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE ... och konstigt nog lukten av pengar som spenderas! Knaskatt.
school_story_16_screen_1_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Den kanske hjälper dig spara!
school_story_16_screen_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Men, prata ska vi göra! Och vi ska prata om att spendera och olika sätt att betala på.

school_story_16_screen_2_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Att göra av med något?
school_story_16_screen_3_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Det kan vara svårt att definiera när man inte specificerar vad man pratar om, för man kan ju spendera massor av andra saker förutom pengar.
school_story_16_screen_3_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Man kan spendera tid t.ex. Och du kan spendera sommaren på att vila hjärnan. Och såklart så spenderar man ju pengar.
school_story_16_screen_3_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Ja! Bra sätt att spendera sommaren på!
school_story_16_screen_3_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Jag gillar att använda hjärnan
school_story_16_screen_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Och själva ordet spendera betyder ‘att använda något med förståelsen att det kan ta slut’. Vilket är väldigt passande för just pengar!
school_story_16_screen_4_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Om man bara spenderar pengar så kommer de ta slut. Det är precis därför man tjänar och sparar också: för att kunna spendera pengar utan att de tar slut!
school_story_16_screen_4_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Ja! Nu ser jag kopplingen!
school_story_16_screen_4_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Ah får tänka på detta
school_story_16_screen_5_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Spenderar du dessutom smart, så kommer de räcka ännu längre och till fler saker!
school_story_16_screen_6_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Vad man gör när man spenderar pengar är att man betalar för saker. Det kan vara att man köper produkter eller tjänster man vill ha, eller betalar räkningar som är nödvändiga.
school_story_16_screen_6_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Därför tänkte jag att du behöver få veta om olika sätt att betala på och hur de funkar.
school_story_16_screen_7_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Idag är så mycket av våra pengar digitala, och det gör att vi har massor av lösningar för hur man kan betala. Förutom alla vanliga.
school_story_16_screen_7_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Jag kan nämna några. Du kan betala med telefonen på flera sätt, som Swish eller applewallet. Man kan ju till och med betala med sin smartwatch!
school_story_16_screen_7_button_1_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Inte tänkt på hur många det finns!
school_story_16_screen_7_button_2_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Har använt flera av dem
school_story_16_screen_8_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE I destinationerna på denna planeten, kommer vi prata om de mer klassiska visen man betalar på.
school_story_16_screen_8_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE Det gör vi för att de nya digitala lösningarna är alla baserade på dem.
school_story_16_screen_8_button_4_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Nu vill jag veta mer
school_story_16_screen_9_title: PLZ_TRANSLATE Till exempel så kan man betala med applewallet för att man har lagt in uppgifterna från sitt bankkort...
school_story_16_screen_9_subtitle: PLZ_TRANSLATE ...så ska man vara petig så betalar man faktiskt med sitt kort, men GENOM sin telefon. Så det är de klassiska visen man behöver förstå först!
